answer:
It is important to bring your child's immunization record with you to the appointment so that the nurse or doctor can fill it out. If your child was born in BC, you should have received a Child Health Passport that contains an immunization record. If you didn't receive one, you can request one from your local health unit.
There are things you can do before, during, and after the immunization appointment that can help make immunizations easier and less stressful for both you and your child. Find more information here.
Immunization Nurse
question: What do I need to bring other than my infants care card when getting immunized?
